description: From Middle English bemornen, from Old English bemurnan (“to mourn, bewail, deplore, be sorry for, care for, take heed for”), equivalent to be- (“over, about”) +‎ mourn. Cognate with Old Saxon bimornian (“to bemourn”).

verbs.description: bemourn (third-person singular simple present bemourns, present participle bemourning, simple past and past participle bemourned)

entries.meaning: (transitive, rare) To weep or mourn over.
